name: unresponsiveness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not reacting to something or of not reacting in a quick or positive way : unresponsiveness to Customers expressed frustration at the bank's unresponsiveness to multiple inquiries.unresponsiveness of Those who seek protection are frustrated by the unresponsiveness of state agencies.
the fact of not reacting or moving at all because of being unconscious or very ill: After establishing unresponsiveness, which of the following actions should the nurse take first?
More examplesFewer examplesVictims encounter unresponsiveness and hostility at each level of the criminal justice system.Unresponsiveness to instructions, forgetfulness, or confusion may all be common in an individual with cognitive disabilities. She was admitted to a local hospital due to unresponsiveness. Coma at first resembles normal sleep, but later progresses to total unresponsiveness.
